comment.author: 30265340@N00
comment._content: the same type of wagon as used in the Hunter Valley.

comment.author: 33944233@N07
comment._content: This looks like a development of what was known in the UK as the cauldron wagon. They were used on both wagonways before the development of steam power and on mineral lines through to pre - war (WWII). Some of the last original ones in use were at Seaham Harbour in County Durham UK up till the early 1970's
